text:
Child of Light.
Take flight!
Journey to save our world and fight!
To end the everlasting night.
Shed the world of old you yearn for.
This world needs a saviour!
With your silver wings.
And your sword that sings...
Child of Light!
Face the champions of the night!
And discover your new home.
For your body in its tomb.

text: That's a thing above and beyond Yoko Shimomura. ¬†However, the way the soundtrack is written reminds me of Shimomura much more, due to the combinations of timbres. ¬†Taiko Drum + Snare Drum + Strings, particularly violas + Piano is a very evocative combination.

text: If you're thinking about picking this up for Playstation, I recommend getting the Deluxe Edition. It doesn't come with an actual disc either, but has some DLC that adds another character to your party (definitely a boon if you're playing in Hard) and comes with a cute little light-up Igniculus keychain and a gorgeous poster and a nice little art book.

text: This game definitely blew me away. Kudos to Ubisoft for hiring this team into making a really good game. The art, music and atmosphere is definitely the high points of the game and the unique characters you encounter on your journey. The battle system is similar to the Grandia series with is a plus and overall, from the few hours I played the game, it really has made an impression on me. I definitely recommend you pick it up Supra!

text: I love how Ubisoft asked Amano to paint this artwork for their game. I associate Amano with Square games so much (mainly Final Fantasy) that it feels weird to see his work on other games. Any impressions by the way? Looks very good. I'll surely buy it on Steam at some point.
author: SupraDarky

text: Well, hearing this theme, I just might buy it...
author: Jorsett

text:
I really like the game.
The game has a co-op mode,where one player controls the¬†surprising usefull wisp side kick.
It's great if you want to play them game together with your child,little brother/sister or gf.
Combat is similar to grandia,except that you can use the wisp to slow down enemies.
It's not very difficult,hard mode is probably the way to go,even then it's very easy to get overleveled,but it's easy enough to avoid most battles.
Level design is great,both in terms of visuals and gameplay,each level has tons of teasures and little secrets.
Story is probably the weakest part of the game.
I kind of see why they plot can't be too complex,because it's a game for all ages,but even with that in mind it's still a bit weak.
author: Boddy

text: Definitely one of my favorite games in recent times. I don't think it holds up in all places (the level up system is kinda lackluster, for example), but I recommend it just for the experience. The game is incredibly beautiful in all aspects, music included. The Firefly that joins you is actually both useful and makes the game a lot more interesting in the battles since he provides some real-time strategies between the turn-based battling.
author: JFK piano

text: Playing it at the moment. Art and soundtrack are absolutely brilliant, and the combat is surprisingly innovative for a turn-based system, giving you the ability to interrupt foes' attacks at particular times. Makes gameplay a bit more tactical. Also best played with a friend, as the co-op is completely seamless!
author: HVGBA Qualbert

text: I just got it today, it's a pretty comfortable rpg with 2d platforming and puzzle solving. A tad slow, though.

author: Pogopuschel

text:
Friend bought it. Worth the buy. Igniculus is actually a lot of fun to play for anyone who's more of a 'rts' player. All about minmaxing, managing your team ("Hey, focus down this spider. He's squishy and is super fast. I'll slow the heavyhitter so you can interrupt him."), etc.
Fun game.
author: Denied1213

text: Am playing it on PS4, and it's an awesome game. I can highly recommend it. The devs were clearly using Final Fantasy all the way through as their guiding influence, and even B√©atrice Martin's musical score is extremely reminiscent of Nobuo Uematsu's earlier FF work.
author: jamyskis

text: Really, it is widely worth the purchase : very fun gameplay, actually very challenging when played in Expert, interesting storyline, nice universe, awesome art, likeable characters with a wide array of abilities, every one of them is specialized in a domain and this makes battles very tactical and interesting.
